thread.title: Youth gang attacks Melbourne festival crowd
thread.title_full: Youth gang attacks Melbourne festival crowd

title: Youth gang attacks Melbourne festival crowd
text:
Youth gang attacks Melbourne festival crowd Last updated 20:39, February 13 2017 
A youth gang has terrorised crowds at a Australian music festival, punching and kicking them, and stealing phones, wallets and bags, as families gathered to watch fireworks. 
Around 10pm at the Summersault Festival in Melbourne, an estimated 30 to 40 teenagers of African descent went on a rampage through the event grounds on Saturday night. 
Jack McLaughlin, 16, was jumped on and punched by a group and his phone was stolen. He was hospitalised after the attack. Annie Wall/Facebook 
An estimated 30 to 40 teenagers of African descent went on a rampage through the Summersault Festival in Melbourne. 
Debbie Tesoriero, the boy's mother, told the Herald Sun he does not remember the attack.
